job_description: Statutory Accounting Advisor Bratislava, Slovakia We are a global, multi-billion-dollar corporation – and Accounting is vital to reflecting our staggering earnings, profits, cash balances and other financial results. To meet this challenge, we implement best practices, provide general financial support, resolve queries, prepare reports and provide statistics. We also design policies and procedures that adhere to audit standards and conform to FASB and SEC guidance, as well as compliance with GAAP and Sarbanes-Oxley section 404. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Statutory Accounting Adviso r on our Statutory Accounting Team in Bratislava. What you’ll achieve As an Accounting Advisor, you will resolve financial support issues and inquiries from both internal and external customers and ensure that financial reporting requirements of the company are met. This role will involve: month and quarter end accounting, as well as month end consolidation work, compliance, project work along with some system work such as setup mass allocations journals as required for EMEA entities. You will provide guidance to international finance teams on issues which arise for e.g. SAP, revaluation, liquidations, compliance, tax etc. You will: Complete statutory accounts for Head office entities and liaise with auditors on the audit of these entities and work with outside service providers to prepare and file tax returns for Head office entities Review tax computations and liaising with outside providers on tax returns, review balance sheet reconciliations and review journals booked Manage the month end process including the tracking of month end checks on International entities to ensure that there are no issues before entities are consolidated Provide assistance to the Tax, Treasury and other Finance Departments as requested including projects across International entities Provide suggestions for improving processes performed within the team Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Master's degree in Accounting Fully qualified accountant, ACA, ACCA, etc Have a strong financial and technical accounting background and experience on the preparation of financial statements and tax computations Good interpersonal and communication skills Attention to detail Salary starting from: 1 950 EUR gross/month Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
